greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primitive roots of those integers with at least one primitive root.
comment: Essentially sequence A046144 with all zero entries deleted.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
mathematica: Reap[ Do[ If[n == 1, Sow[1], If[ IntegerQ[ PrimitiveRoot[n]], Sow[ EulerPhi[ EulerPhi[n]]]]] , {n, 1, 100}]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 24 2012 *)
program: (PARI) is(n)=if(n%2, isprimepower(n) || n==1, n==2 || n==4 || (isprimepower(n/2, &n) && n>2));
lista(nn) = for (n=1, nn, if (is(n), print1(eulerphi(eulerphi(n)), ", "))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 12 2017
results.author: _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jul 03 2002
